items.content:
The ETF That Bought Venezuela at the Right Time -

Venezuela bonds were up 100% even before the surprise US strike. Then they went up another 30%.

Venezuela to Set up Funds for Oil Revenues and Amend Energy Law - Venezuela’s acting President Delcy Rodríguez presented a reform to the nation’s hydrocarbons law and announced the creation of two funds into which dollars from oil sales will be funneled.

Foreign Holdings of US Treasuries Climbed to Record in November - Overseas holdings of US Treasuries advanced in November to the highest level on record, with increases in Norwegian, Canadian and Saudi Arabian stockpiles helping offset another monthly drop in China’

JPMorgan Deal Cuts Software Firm Relativity’s Private Debt Costs - Legal software firm Relativity ODA LLC has cut borrowing costs on existing private debt in the leveraged loan market, the latest example of public market investors displacing private lenders.

The US Treasury Market’s Inertia Is Nearing Historic Levels - The 10-year Treasury note’s yield is headed for a fifth straight week of minimal change, rivaling its longest stretch of inertia in the past two decades.

Bolsonaro Ordered to Prison to Serve Out Coup Attempt Sentence - A Brazilian Supreme Court justice ordered former President Jair Bolsonaro to prison to continue serving his sentence for trying to remain in power after his narrow 2022 election defeat.

Anthropic Gets a Viral Moment With Cowork Tool Built (Mostly) by AI - The AI company’s newest product has put much of the software industry on alert.

Fed Faces ‘Trilemma’ of How Big Its Balance Sheet Should Be - The Federal Reserve has to grapple with the question of how big its balance sheet should be after it stopped shrinking its $6.5 trillion portfolio, according to economists at the central bank.

Industrial Firm Madison Air Said to Seek $2 Billion-Plus in IPO - Madison Air, a provider of ventilation and filtration systems, is seeking to raise at least $2 billion in a US initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.

Trump Family’s World Liberty Seeks CFO for Proposed Crypto Bank - World Liberty Financial, the crypto platform co-founded by President Donald Trump, has a new offshoot that’s pursuing a bank charter. Its application shows at least one key job vacancy.

Private Equity Firm NGP Makes $200 Million US Battery Bet as AI Stokes Power Demand - Private equity firm NGP Energy Capital Management is backing a new US energy-storage developer with $200 million as data centers spur record power demand growth.

US, Taiwan Reach Deal to Cut Tariffs, Boost Chip Investment - The US and Taiwan agreed to a trade agreement that would lower tariffs on goods from Taiwan to 15%. Taiwanese semiconductor companies will also invest more in US operations. Bloomberg's Michael Shepar

Trump Officials Vow to Keep All US Coal Plants Running - Trump administration officials vowed to keep US coal power plants operating, casting it as an imperative to meet surging electricity demand and drive a revival of the nation’s industrial base.

White-Collar Enforcement Sinks Under Trump, Public Citizen Says - The Trump administration canceled at least 162 corporate enforcement actions and halted 14 more in its first year back in office, according to progressive advocacy group Public Citizen.

Goldman Sachs Names BlackRock’s Lynam as Chief Credit Strategist - Amanda Lynam, head of macro credit research at BlackRock Inc., is returning to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. after three years with the asset management firm.
Podcasting’s New Biggest Threat: the End of Listening - Harried consumers are testing new ways to cram as much podcast information into their brains as possible without listening to full episodes

Us Indefinitely Suspends Immigration Visas From 75 Countries - The US announced an indefinite suspension of processing immigrant visas for people from 75 countries, in an escalation of the Trump’s administration’s crackdown on immigration.

Tyler Kendall reports.

Spain Plans €10.5 Billion ‘Sovereign Fund’ to Follow NextGen EU - Spain will launch a €10.5 billion ($12.2 billion) investment fund to maintain support for its economy after European Union pandemic-recovery efforts wind down, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said.

The AI startup is requesting proposals from hardware makers as part of a product expansion
